responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: OS command injection in deploy.sh via git submodule URLs
    analysis: |
      The script deploys a WordPress plugin from a local git repository to a remote SVN repository.
      It iterates over the `url` values of each submodule in the `.gitmodules` file, without any sanitization.
      If an attacker can control the content of the `.gitmodules` file at the time the script is run, they can inject arbitrary commands that will be executed by the shell during the `git submodule foreach` command.
    cwe: CWE-78
    function_names: []
    filenames:
      - deploy.sh
    classification: very promising
  - headline: Information disclosure in deploy.sh via error messages
    analysis: |
      The script may print the URLs of git submodules in case of an error during the `git submodule foreach` command.
      An attacker could craft a malicious URL that triggers an error, leading to the disclosure of potentially sensitive information.
    cwe: CWE-209
    function_names: []
    filenames:
      - deploy.sh
    classification: slightly promising
```

leads.headline: OS command injection in deploy.sh via git submodule URLs
leads.analysis:
The script deploys a WordPress plugin from a local git repository to a remote SVN repository.
It iterates over the url values of each submodule in the .gitmodules file, without any sanitization.
If an attacker can control the content of the .gitmodules file at the time the script is run, they can inject arbitrary commands that will be executed by the shell during the git submodule foreach command.

leads.headline: Information disclosure in deploy.sh via error messages
leads.analysis:
The script may print the URLs of git submodules in case of an error during the git submodule foreach command.
An attacker could craft a malicious URL that triggers an error, leading to the disclosure of potentially sensitive information.
